question: A full-wave rectifier with diodes <katex>$D_{1}$</katex> and <katex>$D_{2}$</katex> is used to rectify 50 Hz alternating voltage. The diode <katex>$D_{1}$</katex> conducts how many times in one second.
explanation: In a full-wave rectifier, <katex>$D_1$</katex> conducts during the positive half-cycles and <katex>$D_2$</katex> conducts during the negative half-cycles.
The input frequency is 50 Hz, meaning there are 50 full cycles per second.
Therefore, there are 50 positive half-cycles per second.
<katex>$D_1$</katex> conducts once per cycle, so 50 times per second.
